page.title: 02MARCHON CHEMICAL WORKS
page.content: Marchon chemical works exists on the site of the old Ladysmith Pit coke ovens at Kells.The company moved here in 1943 and in the early days made firelighters,toiletries and shampoo preparations.The company then expanded to make detergents and sulphuric acid.By co-incidence sulphuric acid can be made from anhydrite,and large deposits of anhydrite ,known to exist underneath the works site,were mined.New technology in the production of phosphoric acid and chemicals for detergent making meant more imports of phosphate rock from Casablanca,which enters Whitehaven via its harbour. The works now dominate the skyline at Kells with its large towers and chimneys.Local residents complain about the smells and dust.The works is a major employer in the town and is part of the Albright & Wilson group.
